message_1: Suppose there are 100 fish in a lake shared by 10 fishermen. Each fisherman can catch up to 5 fish per day. If the fishermen act independently and try to maximize their catch, how many fish will be left in the lake after 10 days?
message_2:
If each fisherman can catch up to 5 fish per day, and there are 10 fishermen, then they can catch a total of 5 fish/day * 10 fishermen = 50 fish per day.

After 10 days, they would have caught 50 fish/day * 10 days = 500 fish in total. However, there are only 100 fish in the lake. Therefore, the fishermen will catch all the fish in the lake, and there will be 0 fish left after 10 days.
